result.markdown:
---
title: Why a Swift GeoStack?
date: last-modified
date-format: long
order: 2
---

Because everything is more fun to work on when it's in Swift!

Developing Apple Native applications is becoming more and more dependent on writing in Swift.

Python and C++ developers have an abundance of scientific libraries at their disposal, but writing a scientific app in Swift requires wrapping those libraries to make them consumable in a Swifty way.

1.  There is very little "geospatial" in the Apple Developer ecosystem.
  - Many C/C++ libraries
  - Difficult to work with in a "Swifty" way.

2. It's difficult to build serious Geospatial Apps for Apple.
  - No serious GIS apps designed for Apple.  ESRI is 100% Windows.  QGIS is the only serious GIS option on macOS.

2. Data Science and Geo Data Science are more important today than ever. As a Swift Developer I want to be able to create amazing apps for the Apple Ecosystem.
